intro: Staphysora, commonly known as the false heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their compact growth habit and clusters of small, often colorful flowers. They typically have smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produce seeds in small, dry fruits. Staphysora species are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in dry, rocky habitats. The genus includes both annual and perennial species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
